trans-unit.source: When overridden in a derived form, provides functionality for loggers that handle events raised by the [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/add/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] engine.
This abstract class provides default implementations for the methods and properties of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Framework.ILogger> interface.
This class can only be instantiated in a derived form.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Logger"></xref> class.
Generates an error message that is in the default format, from a <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.BuildErrorEventArgs"></xref> object.
The arguments of the error event.
A <xref:System.String> that represents an error message in canonical format.
Generates a warning message that is in the default format, from a <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.BuildWarningEventArgs"></xref> object.
The arguments of the warning event.
A <xref:System.String> that represents a warning message in canonical format.
When overridden in a derived class, subscribes the logger to specific events.
This method must be overridden in the derived class to perform initialization logic and to subscribe to build events published by <xref:Microsoft.Build.Framework.IEventSource>.
The available events that a logger can subscribe to.
Determines whether the current <xref:Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Logger.Verbosity*> setting is at least the value that is passed in.
The logger verbosity setting passed in.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the current logger verbosity setting is at least the value that is passed in; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the user-defined parameters of the logger.
If the derived class does not take parameters, then it can ignore this property.
The logger parameters.
This value can be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, releases the resources allocated to the logger at the time of initialization or during the build.
This method can be overridden in the derived class to perform shutdown logic, such as releasing acquired resources.
Gets or sets the level of detail to show in the event log.
While a logger is free to choose the events it logs, following the verbosity guidelines creates a consistent user experience.
One of the enumeration values.
The default is <xref href="Microsoft.Build.Framework.LoggerVerbosity"></xref>.
